description: Sample insurance claims for testing the Fraud Detection workflow. Includes legitimate, suspicious, and clearly fraudulent examples based on the Kaggle Insurance Fraud Detection dataset structure.

data.claim_description: I was driving home from work on Route 33 around 5:30 PM when a deer ran across the road. I swerved to avoid it and hit the guardrail on the right shoulder. Front bumper and right headlight assembly damaged. Officer Martinez filed report #2024-CR-8821. Two other drivers stopped and provided their contact information as witnesses.

The other car ran a red light and hit me on the driver side. My back and neck are really hurting. The car is totaled I think. It happened at the intersection of Main and Oak around 11 PM. The other driver left the scene before I could get their information. I didn't call the police because I was in too much pain and just wanted to get home.

My vehicle was stolen from my driveway sometime during the night. When I woke up it was gone. I also had valuable items in the trunk worth about $10,000 including electronics and designer clothing. I am experiencing severe emotional distress and anxiety since this happened and would like compensation for that as well. I need this resolved as quickly as possible.

Three-car pileup on I-66 during morning rush hour at approximately 8:15 AM. A semi truck lost control and pushed the car behind me into my vehicle. I was taken to Virginia Hospital Center by ambulance with whiplash and a fractured collarbone. Dr. Sarah Kim at VHC is my treating physician, case #VHC-2024-11234. Police report #2024-VA-4412 filed by Officer Daniels of Virginia State Police. Four witnesses stopped to provide statements. The semi driver was cited for following too closely.

Lost control on wet road and hit a tree on County Road 12. Significant front-end damage to my truck. I injured my back and knee in the impact. One person driving behind me saw the accident and called 911. Police report was filed.
